meanings.definition: A part of a musical instrument that is placed against the lips to produce sound.
meanings.sent1: The trumpet player blew into the mouthpiece to create beautiful music.
meanings.sent2: The saxophonist carefully cleaned the mouthpiece before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The mouthpiece of the flute whispered sweet melodies to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the mouthpiece of the clarinet, filling the room with enchanting tunes.
meanings.sent5: The mouthpiece of the trombone gleamed under the stage lights, ready to resonate with deep tones.

meanings.definition: A person who speaks on behalf of another or a group.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer acted as a mouthpiece for the defendant in court.
meanings.sent2: The spokesperson served as the official mouthpiece of the company during the press conference.
meanings.sent3: The parrot became the unexpected mouthpiece for the neighborhood gossip.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a powerful mouthpiece for change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The microphone stood as the mouthpiece for the singer's emotions, amplifying her message to the crowd.

meanings.definition: A device used to protect the mouth during sports or other activities.
meanings.sent1: The boxer wore a mouthpiece to shield his teeth during the match.
meanings.sent2: The football player put on his mouthpiece before heading onto the field.
meanings.sent3: The mouthpiece shielded her smile during the intense game of hockey.
meanings.sent4: The mouthpiece was her trusty companion in the rough sport of rugby.
meanings.sent5: The mouthpiece molded perfectly to his teeth, ensuring safety during the game.
